title: Move configuration overview to evergreen blog

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: language/en
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to English language

labels.name: area/blog
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the Kubernetes Blog subproject

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**What would you like to be added**
Move https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/overview/ to become an evergreen blog article.

**Why is this needed**
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/overview/ is not really an overview of configuring Kubernetes. However, it's kind of useful.

Rather than just remove it, I suggest we get someone to blog about this topic, incorporating the ideas from the current page. Then we turn the article [evergreen](https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/blog/#maintenance-evergreen) and set https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/overview/ to redirect to the blog article. 

**Comments**
/language en

/area blog
(kinda)

labels.name: kind/feature

labels.name: language/ko
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to Korean language

labels.name: triage/accepted

body:
**This is a Feature Request**

**What would you like to be added**
<!-- Describe as precisely as possible how this feature/enhancement should work from the user perspective. What should be changed, etc. -->
Sync Korean documents under `/docs/concepts/architecture` with the latest English content.
This umbrella issue will track the progress of updates to multiple outdated files.

Target files include:

- [ ] /docs/concepts/architecture/cloud-controller.md
https://kubernetes.io/ko/docs/concepts/architecture/cloud-controller/
- [ ] /docs/concepts/architecture/controller.md
https://kubernetes.io/ko/docs/concepts/architecture/controller/
- [ ] /docs/concepts/architecture/cri.md
https://kubernetes.io/ko/docs/concepts/architecture/cri/
- [ ] /docs/concepts/architecture/garbage-collection.md
https://kubernetes.io/ko/docs/concepts/architecture/garbage-collection/

Small fixes will be grouped in one PR, and the rest will be submitted separately.

**Why is this needed**

Some pages under `/docs/concepts/architecture` are outdated compared to the latest English version.
To maintain consistency and accuracy, these documents need to be synchronized with the upstream content.

**Comments**
<!-- Any additional related comments that might help. Drawings/mockups would be extremely helpful (if required). -->

/language ko

title: Adding Windows worker nodes - Flannel docs (sig) link is broken

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Denotes an issue that needs help from a contributor. Must meet "help wanted" guidelines.

labels.name: sig/windows
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Windows.

labels.name: sig/docs
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Docs.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
The doc links to https://sigs.k8s.io/sig-windows-tools/guides/flannel.md which is unavailable (HTTP 404).

I'm attempting to deploy a Windows-based Kubernetes node. My starting point is https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/kubeadm/adding-windows-nodes/.

When the node is deployed and joined, I need to configure networking as it is described in the [Network configuration](
https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/kubeadm/adding-windows-nodes/#network-configuration) section of the document. But I'm stuck since there is no further guidance and the linked document is unavailable.

BTW, which other relevant documentation (or any other resources) are recommended for Windows worker nodes deployment?

Thank you!

title: Use Hugo functions  and methods to render times in code samples

labels.name: sig/docs
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Docs.

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: Higher priority than priority/awaiting-more-evidence.

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
In the example for "Bootstrap Token Secret Format", the value for `expiration` is several years old. This means that if you are testing with the example, it will appear to be created, but it is not actually created, since it was rejected because the expiration date was expired. Consider putting a later expiration date in the example or making a note about it in the paragraphs that follow. Otherwise, it is not incredibly obvious why the secret does not successfully create.

`kubectl apply -f bootstrap-token-07401b.yaml`
`secret/bootstrap-token-07401b created`

`kubectl get secret -n kube-system`
`No resources found in kube-system namespace.`

Version: v1.33.5

title: radial/busyboxplus:curl in the tutorial is no longer supported

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: Higher priority than priority/awaiting-more-evidence.

labels.name: language/en
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to English language

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**This is a Bug Report**

<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before submitting, please fill in the following information. -->
<!-- See https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/start/ for guidance on writing an actionable issue description. -->

<!--Required Information-->
**Problem:** When trying to use the image for the tutorial radial/busyboxplus:curl

I get this error even though kube-dns is already running:
```
Events:
  Type     Reason     Age                  From               Message
  ----     ------     ----                 ----               -------
  Normal   Scheduled  3m7s                 default-scheduler  Successfully assigned default/curl to docker-desktop
  Normal   BackOff    20s (x11 over 3m5s)  kubelet            Back-off pulling image "radial/busyboxplus:curl"
  Warning  Failed     20s (x11 over 3m5s)  kubelet            Error: ImagePullBackOff
  Normal   Pulling    7s (x5 over 3m7s)    kubelet            Pulling image "radial/busyboxplus:curl"
  Warning  Failed     5s (x5 over 3m6s)    kubelet            Failed to pull image "radial/busyboxplus:curl": Error response from daemon: not implemented: media type "application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.v1+prettyjws" is no longer supported since containerd v2.1, please rebuild the image as "application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.v2+json" or "application/vnd.oci.image.manifest.v1+json"
  Warning  Failed     5s (x5 over 3m6s)    kubelet            Error: ErrImagePull
```

**Proposed Solution:** Include a working image in the documentation under the DNS section

**Page to Update:**
https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/access-application-cluster/service-access-application-cluster/

<!--Optional Information (remove the comment tags around information you would like to include)-->
<!--Kubernetes Version:--> 1.34

<!--Additional Information:-->

title: Describe the migration from systemd's cgroup v1 CPU shares to v2 CPU weight formula

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: sig/node
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**This is a Feature Request**

Docs needs to be added to explain the change in CPU shares weight calculation for cgroupv2.

- when the change happened
- dependant components that are responsible
- how to make sure k8s is aligned with runc on this calculation
- any sideeffects
- what effect it has on older k8s versions

**What would you like to be added**

See https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/issues/5246#issuecomment-3369116530

/sig node
/milestone v1.35
/cc @haircommander @iholder101

**Why is this needed**

**Comments**
This change should not affect regular users, but may need explanation for cluster administrators. We will need to link relnotes for 1.35 to this documentation. Theoretically is can affect already released versions as well, but we will mention it in 1.35 notes.

title: Replace docs.microsoft.com links with learn.microsoft.com to avoid redirect (301)

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: Higher priority than priority/awaiting-more-evidence.

labels.name: kind/cleanup
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to cleaning up code, process, or technical debt.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**This is a Feature Request**

**What would you like to be added**

All `docs.microsoft.com` links in the English Kubernetes website documentation should be updated to `learn.microsoft.com` links.
Currently, many links still point to the old `docs.microsoft.com` domain, but these URLs respond with an HTTP 301 redirect to `learn.microsoft.com`. Updating the links in the source content will make them future-proof and remove unnecessary redirects.

**Why is this needed**

docs.microsoft.com has been deprecated and now redirects to `learn.microsoft.com`.
Keeping outdated links may cause long-term maintenance issues if Microsoft changes their redirect rules.

A quick search shows more than 100 occurrences of `docs.microsoft.com` in the kubernetes/website repository, so a systematic fix is needed.

**Comments**

```bash
$ curl --head https://docs.microsoft.com/virtualization/windowscontainers/manage-containers/container-security
HTTP/2 301 
server: AkamaiGHost
content-length: 0
location: https://learn.microsoft.com/virtualization/windowscontainers/manage-containers/container-security
```

Reference search result:
https://cs.k8s.io/?q=docs.microsoft.com&i=nope&literal=nope&files=content%2Fen&excludeFiles=&repos=kubernetes/website

title: Add hyperlinks etc into node status reference page

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
Hey there,

_[issue edited by maintainer]_

on https://k8s.io/docs/reference/node/node-status/ it is written:
"The kubelet updates the node's .status either when there is change in status or if there has been no update for a configured interval. The default interval for .status updates to Nodes is 5 minutes, which is much longer than the 40 second default timeout for unreachable nodes."

It would be nice if there would be references to pages that explain how to adjust these and other default values mentioned on that page.

Best regards
Dom

title: Clarify init container, regular init container, non-init container and sidecar container

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: sig/node
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.

labels.name: sig/docs
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Docs.

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: Higher priority than priority/awaiting-more-evidence.

labels.name: language/en
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to English language

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**This is a Feature Request**

The use of init container, non-init container, regular init container and sidecar container is fairly confusing in this doc https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/content/en/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/sidecar-containers.md#resource-sharing-within-containers . For example in the resource-sharing-within-containers section it is not clean if (non-init containers) excludes init containers with `restartPolicy` set to `Always` or only excludes `regular init containers` as defined earlier in the doc.

**What would you like to be added**

This PR attempts to make that clarification https://github.com/kubernetes/website/pull/52509

**Why is this needed**

The terminology for sidecar containers is fairly confusing. In the pointed out section, the problem is especially acute.

**Comments**

title: Validation for feature gates data in docs

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: Higher priority than priority/awaiting-more-evidence.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**This is a Feature Request**
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting feature/enhancement requests -->
<!-- See https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/start/ for guidance on writing an actionable issue description. -->

**What would you like to be added**
<!-- Describe as precisely as possible how this feature/enhancement should work from the user perspective. What should be changed, etc. -->
Based on the idea in the parent issue [#52376:  Validation for feature gates data](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/52376#issuecomment-3300494737)
Add a validation mechanism that ensures the feature gates documented in `Kubernetes/Website` are always consistent with the source of truth in the upstream `Kubernetes/Kubernetes` codebase for each release.

**Why is this needed**

- Prevent drift between documents and upstream `Kubernetes/Kubernetes`.
- Reduce manual errors when updating documentation for new releases.
- Ensure readers always have accurate feature gate information.

**Comments**
<!-- Any additional related comments that might help. Drawings/mockups would be extremely helpful (if required). -->
Happy to explore approaches and work on this. Suggestions from maintainers on the best starting point would be helpful.

Also see issue https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/50992

CC: @lmktfy

title: Containerized reference docs generation

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed and/or may need multiple releases to complete.

body:
**This is a Feature Request**

<!-- Please only use this template for submitting feature/enhancement requests -->
<!-- See https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/start/ for guidance on writing an actionable issue description. -->

**What would you like to be added**
When we generate the reference docs, make it possible to do this with a command similar to:
`docker run registry.k8s.io/tooling/reference-docs-builder:1.34`
or
`podman run registry.k8s.io/tooling/reference-docs-builder:1.34`
(other container runtimes are available)
<!-- Describe as precisely as possible how this feature/enhancement should work from the user perspective. What should be changed, etc. -->

**Why is this needed**
Based on the parent issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/52376

**Comments**
Allen: I would appreciate a bit more contexts on what is current workflow, and do we have any preferred container runtimes(I would prefer docker).

Is it only automation of existing flow, or I need to add additional steps?

@lmktfy and any other stakeholders
<!-- Any additional related comments that might help. Drawings/mockups would be extremely helpful (if required). -->

title: Improvements to automation

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed and/or may need multiple releases to complete.

labels.name: lifecycle/frozen
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or PR should not be auto-closed due to staleness.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
#   _This is an umbrella issue_  

!["Always has been meme" but with a giant Kubernetes logo instead of Earth](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/057df415-fd00-4b25-b18c-47bb5928e2fb)

_Wait, it's not all automated?      Never has been._

 Please read this description to learn more about how to interact with this umbrella issue and its children.

---

## Topic 

This umbrella issue covers gaps in automation for SIG Docs and the things that SIG Docs looks after, notably:

1. this [Git repository](https://github.com/kubernetes/website) ([k/website](https://github.com/kubernetes/website)), and the website at https://k8s.io/
1. the reference docs [generator](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/reference-docs) code

## How to contribute  

This is an umbrella issue. The first few comments are all suggested subtopics, and we'll open child issues for the work that we want to track in detail. You can use a  reaction on a comment to mark that you agree with it (please do this rather than replying with short comments such as "**I agree**", "[Bedlam DL3](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/exchange/me-too/610643)", or "**me too!**".

If you find a child issue and want to work on it, you just can! Visit https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/ to learn more.

## Ideas

If you have an idea, great. Please reply with your idea here. It might get enough votes to become its own child issue that the SIG can staff.

body:
Current page is unclear on the use of

"New-Item config -type file"

At minimum, page needs to explicitly state this is powershell syntax.
Better would be to match the style of earlier in the page, where specific instructions for powershell vs "cmd.exe" are both given.

title: probes: missing documentation of the mandatory random initial delay

labels.name: sig/node
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: priority/backlog
labels.description: Higher priority than priority/awaiting-more-evidence.

labels.name: language/en
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to English language

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

body:
**Problem:**

Probes are always initially delayed by a random duration based on `periodSeconds`. This is not documented. I and and others have had to rediscover it by searching bugs and code to understand what is happening.

**Proposed Solution:**

Document that confusing behaviour.

**Page to Update:**

https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/liveness-readiness-startup-probes/ and/or https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/

**Additional Information:**

The [relevant code](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/2e83bc4bf31e88b7de81d5341939d5ce2460f46f/pkg/kubelet/prober/worker.go#L148-L155).

A [related bug](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/62036) against kubernetes was closed without resolution but it clearly shows many people have been and keep being confused about this.

There is also a [different but somewhat related bug](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/48519) against the documentation.

I would send a PR or specific wording proposal but based on [past experience](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/pull/51374), you would reject it.
